label: AB3C4_cP8_215_a_c_e-001
title: Cubic Lazarevi\'{c}ite (AsCu$_{3}$S$_{4}$) Structure
comments:
This structure is very similar to \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4C_cP8_215_c_e_b-001}{sulvanite ($H2_{4}$)}, except that in this case the copper atoms are on the cubic faces [the (3c) sites] rather than the cubic edges [the (3d) sites]. The actual composition of the sample under study is Cu$_{3}$(As$_{0.65}$Cu$_{0.20}$Fe$_{0.13}$)S$_{4}$. We will ignore the alloying on the arsenic site here. 
 (Sclar, 1960) set $x_{3} = 1/4$, but that is not required by symmetry and there is undoubtedly some relaxation. 
 After much searching we finally obtained the original article for this structure from the \href{https://archive.org/details/sim_geological-society-of-america-bulletin_1960-12_71_12_0/page/1970/mode/1up}{Internet Archive}.  We thank them for making these documents available.
